question: 乾く
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>dry</kanji>. This verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to get dry</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to become dry</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>to be dried</vocabulary>. You're not doing the drying, it's just happening. That's <reading>coo</reading>', you say, things can get dry all by themselves.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The <ja><reading>川</reading></ja> (<ja>かわ</ja>) has started <vocabulary>to get dry</vocabulary>. Need to use less water around here otherwise it'll become completely dry.
